result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A. Gouza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Computer Message-Threaten/Disclose ID, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(f).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution was paid prior to sentencing.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim to be preapproved by the victim witness coordinator.  This letter has been done.  Defendant shall have a psychological evaluation and comply with any treatment recommendations.  Defendant shall obtain counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall obtain his school diploma or equivalency.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Jacob A. Gouza in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have been complied.  Plea of  no contest to amended charges of Count 1 - DC; Count 2 - Unlawful Use of Computerized Communication System; Count 3 - Obstructing an Officer. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.   Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders withheld sentence of one year probation with conditions court costs on each count, DNA surcharge on Count 1 only; 60 days county jail with huber on count 1; letter of apology to the victim due prior to sentencing preapproved by victim witness coordinator; restitution of $3,431.37 to be paid prior to sentencing; psychological evaluation and compliance with treatment recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation agent; obtain high school diploma or equivalency.  Jail to begin no later than April 1, 2015 at 4:30 p.m.  Defendant may apply for expungement upon successful completion of probation.   - rt

Defendant Jacob A. Gouza in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives a preliminary hearing.  Information filed.  Waive reading of information. Plea of not guilty to the charge.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.  - rt

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no use of social media. Defendant shall not enter property owned by the Medford Public Schools. The only exception is for the purpose of attending the alternative school.

Defendant Jacob A. Gouza in court with attorney Daniel T. Cveykus.  Kristi Sue Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of complaint; preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived.  PTC set.  State requested a $3000 signature bond with booking; no use of social media; no entering property owned by Medford Public Schools, except for purposes of attending the alternative school.  No objection - so ordered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
